intro: Psychotria subsessiliflora var. carinata, commonly known as the Carinate Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features elliptical leaves with a distinctive midrib ridge, giving it its varietal name "carinata." Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have a white or pale pink color. This species is often found in humid, shaded forest understories where it thrives in moist, well-drained soil.
